Package ohos.event.notification

Class NotificationHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.event.notification.NotificationHelper

  • public class NotificationHelper
extends Object
    Manages notifications.

    The methods provided by this class are all static and can be called without creating an object of this class.

    Generally, only system applications have permissions on notification subscription and unsubscription. You can specify the content of a notification to be published and the content is carried by NotificationRequest. A notification ID is unique in an application and must be specified when using NotificationRequest to carry the notification content. If a notification with this ID has been published and you need to use this ID to publish another notification, the original notification will be updated. In addition, the notification ID can be used to cancel a notification by calling the cancelNotification(int) method.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    NotificationRequest
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Notification#ANS

    • Method Detail

      • publishNotification

        public static void publishNotification​(NotificationRequest request)
                                throws RemoteException
        Publishes a notification.

        If a notification with the same ID has been published by the current application and has not been deleted, this method will update the notification.

        Parameters:
        request - Indicates the NotificationRequest object for setting the notification content. This parameter must be specified.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if request is null.
        Since:
        1

      • publishNotification

        public static void publishNotification​(String label,
                                       NotificationRequest request)
                                throws RemoteException
        Publishes a notification with a specified label.

        If a notification with the same ID has been published by the current application and has not been deleted, this method will update the notification.

        Parameters:
        label - Indicates the label of the notification to publish.
        request - Indicates the NotificationRequest object for setting the notification content. This parameter must be specified.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if request is null.
        Since:
        1

      • publishNotification

        public static void publishNotification​(NotificationRequest request,
                                       String deviceId)
                                throws RemoteException
        Publishes a notification on a specified remote device.

        If a notification with the same ID has been published by the current application and has not been deleted, this method will update the notification.

        Parameters:
        request - Indicates the NotificationRequest object for setting the notification content. This parameter must be specified.
        deviceId - Indicates the ID of the remote device. If this parameter is null or an empty string, the notification will be published on the local device.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if request is null.
        Since:
        3

      • cancelNotification

        public static void cancelNotification​(int notificationId)
                               throws RemoteException
        Cancels a published notification.
        Parameters:
        notificationId - Indicates the unique notification ID in the application. The value must be the ID of a published notification. Otherwise, this method does not take effect.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        Since:
        1

        public static void cancelAllNotifications​()
                                   throws RemoteException
        Cancels all the published notifications. To cancel a specified notification, see cancelNotification(int).
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        Since:
        1

      • addNotificationSlot

        public static void addNotificationSlot​(NotificationSlot slot)
                                throws RemoteException
        Creates a notification slot. You can call the NotificationRequest#setSlotId(String) method to bind the slot for publishing.

        A NotificationSlot instance cannot be used directly after being initialized. Instead, you have to call this method to create a notification slot and bind the slot ID to a NotificationRequest object so that the notification published can have all the characteristics set in the NotificationSlot.

        After a notification slot is created by using this method, only the name and description of the notification slot can be changed. Changes to the other attributes, such as the vibration status and notification tone, will no longer take effect.

        Parameters:
        slot - Indicates the notification slot to be created, which is set by NotificationSlot. This parameter must be specified.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if slot is null.
        Since:
        1

      • removeNotificationSlot

        public static void removeNotificationSlot​(String slotId)
                                   throws RemoteException
        Deletes a created notification slot based on the slot ID.
        Parameters:
        slotId - Indicates the ID of the slot, which is created by addNotificationSlot(ohos.event.notification.NotificationSlot). This parameter must be specified.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if slotId is null or an empty string, or if an IPC exception occurs.
        Since:
        1

        public static NotificationSlot getNotificationSlot​(String slotId)
                                            throws RemoteException

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if slotId is null or an empty string, or if an IPC exception occurs.

      • setNotificationBadgeNum

        public static void setNotificationBadgeNum​(int num)
                                    throws RemoteException
        Sets the number to be displayed on the notification badge of the application.
        Parameters:
        num - Indicates the number to display. A negative number indicates that the badge setting remains unchanged. The value 0 indicates that no badge is displayed on the application icon. If the value is greater than 99, 99+ will be displayed.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        Since:
        3

      • addNotificationSlotGroup

        public static void addNotificationSlotGroup​(NotificationSlotGroup slotGroup)
                                     throws RemoteException
        Creates a notification slot group to which a NotificationSlot object can be bound by calling NotificationSlot#setSlotGroup(String).

        A NotificationSlotGroup instance cannot be used directly after being initialized. Instead, you have to call this method to create a notification slot group so that you can bind NotificationSlot objects to it.

        Parameters:
        slotGroup - Indicates the notification slot group to be created, which is set by NotificationSlotGroup. This parameter must be specified.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if slotGroup is null.
        Since:
        3

      • addNotificationSlotGroups

        public static void addNotificationSlotGroups​(List<NotificationSlotGroup> slotGroups)
                                      throws RemoteException
        Creates multiple notification slot groups.

        The precautions for using this method are similar to those for addNotificationSlotGroup(ohos.event.notification.NotificationSlotGroup).

        Parameters:
        slotGroups - Indicates a list of NotificationSlotGroup objects to create. This parameter cannot be null.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if slotGroups is null.
        Since:
        3

      • publishNotificationAsBundle

        public static void publishNotificationAsBundle​(String representativeBundle,
                                               NotificationRequest request)
                                        throws RemoteException
        Publishes a notification in the name of a specified application bundle. If the notification to be published has the same ID as a published notification that has not been canceled, the existing notification will be replaced by the new one.
        Parameters:
        representativeBundle - Indicates the name of the application bundle that allows your application to publish notifications for it by calling setNotificationAgent(java.lang.String).
        request - Indicates the NotificationRequest object to be published.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if request or representativeBundle is null or if representativeBundle is an empty string.
        Since:
        3

      • setNotificationAgent

        public static void setNotificationAgent​(String agent)
                                 throws RemoteException
        Allows another application to act as an agent to publish notifications in the name of your application bundle. You can revoke this authorization by passing null to this method.
        Parameters:
        agent - Indicates the name of the application bundle that can publish notifications for your application.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        Since:
        3

      • getNotificationAgent

        public static String getNotificationAgent​()
                                   throws RemoteException
        Obtains the name of the application bundle that can publish notifications in the name of your application.
        Returns:
        Returns the name of the application bundle that can publish notifications for your application if any; returns null otherwise.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        Since:
        3

      • canPublishNotificationAsBundle

        public static boolean canPublishNotificationAsBundle​(String representativeBundle)
                                              throws RemoteException
        Checks whether your application has permission to publish notifications by calling publishNotificationAsBundle(java.lang.String,ohos.event.notification.NotificationRequest) in the name of another application indicated by the given representativeBundle.
        Parameters:
        representativeBundle - Indicates the name of application bundle your application is representing.
        Returns:
        Returns true if your application can publish notifications for the given representativeBundle; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if representativeBundle is null.
        Since:
        3

      • areNotificationsSuspended

        public static boolean areNotificationsSuspended​()
                                         throws RemoteException
        Checks whether this application is in the suspended state. Applications in this state cannot publish notifications.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this application is suspended; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        Since:
        3

      • getBundleImportance

        public static int getBundleImportance​()
                               throws RemoteException
        Obtains the importance level of this application.
        Returns:
        Returns the importance level of this application, which can be NotificationSlot#LEVEL_NONE, NotificationSlot#LEVEL_MIN, NotificationSlot#LEVEL_LOW, NotificationSlot#LEVEL_DEFAULT, NotificationSlot#LEVEL_HIGH, or NotificationSlot#LEVEL_UNDEFINED.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        Since:
        3
